topics.body:
"@igotnopicks":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54d959d1636872340a943500#post_54d959d1636872340a943500
[bq="igotnopicks"]"@EHAN":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54d958f86368721ad9050f00#post_54d958f86368721ad9050f00
What if you have no pool and no air conditioning.

Have fun in the 100 degree heat :p[/bq]
In Arizona? That's pretty much unheard of, I assume it's illegal to not have air conditioning and/or a pool at your residence.

Also, 100 degrees? That's perfectly gorgeous weather even _without_ a pool or air conditioning. Above 115F though, now THAT'S starting to get ridiculous. 

Heck, I remember a day when it was 122F. 

That was a fun day.
topics.author: 9ba2e84e636164642cc03200

topics.body:
I'm amazed I'm not dead
I remember one time I had an uninflated balloon in my mouth and I sucked on the end of it and it turned inside out in my mouth
And then I did it again
I amused myself this way for like fifteen minutes and never once choked to death. 
And then this other time I stuck my finger in an active light bulb socket. 
And then another time I rubbed my hand over a piece of metal that was stuck in an electrical outlet because it felt funny. 


I was not an intelligent child
topics.author: 500b587e7f123b1f230014a9

topics.body:
I'm getting increasingly more angry at my family.

I got a job and such and was told that if I work towards getting my own car and such I have two years, *BUT* I said that I want to go to online college then next fucking second I was told I had six months.

The two years thing I can totally understand, but the turning around and going six months *CAUSE* you want to take online college doesn't make any fucking sense.


Okay; I know I don't get how the average person thinks, but this doesn't seem logical to me.  Why would you tell someone that you want them out a year and a half earlier because they're going to college?
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
